oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1958-10-11 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from October 11, 1958. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Ferlin Husky (host/performer), guest performers the Wilburn Brothers, and regular performers the Jordanaires, Tommy Jackson, Chet Atkins, June Carter, and Stringbean. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 992nd broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Chet Atkins; June Carter; Wilburn Brothers; Stringbean; Ferlin Husky
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Twelfth Street Rag (Chet Atkins) [continued from part 1] -- Ferlin Husky introduces June Carter -- Comedy routine (June Carter, Ferlin Husky) -- Prince Albert commercial (June Carter, Ferlin Husky) -- Prince Albert jingle -- Ferlin Husky introduces the Wilburn Brothers -- Cry Baby Cry (Wilburn Brothers) -- Ferlin Husky introduces Stringbean -- I Wonder Where Wanda Went (Stringbean) -- Grant Turner introduces Ferlin Husky -- All Of The Time (Ferlin Husky) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Ferlin Husky) -- Camel Cigarettes jingle -- Station announcements (Grant Turner)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Turner, Grant; Cash, June Carter, 1929-2003; Atkins, Chet; Stringbean, 1915-1973; Jackson, Tommy; Jordanaires (Musical group); Husky, Ferlin; Wilburn Brothers; Wilburn, Teddy; Wilburn, Doyle; Wilburn, Lester; Wilburn, Leslie
